result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas P Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs. 
Reimburse Walworth County Drug Unit for "buy money" in the amount of $200.00
 If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
---------------------------------------

Maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both.
---------------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to possess prescription medication without a valid prescription and only in accordance with the prescribed amounts. 
No contact with Stephanie Stewart, Kylee Rugen or Anthony Gerambio.
---------------------------------------

Comply with any counseling recommended by Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas P Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:05 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lucas P Coleman in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  
Matter is before the Court for a sentencing hearing.  Court makes record as to charge and maximum potential penalties.  There were numerous other counts that were dismissed and read-in.  Parties confirm that they are both free to argue.  Court has reviewed the file, the PSI and other information contained in court file as well as the letters of support submitted by the defense.  
Both sides have reviewed the PSI and they do not have any additions of corrections.  
10:08 am  Statement by Paige Danielsen on behalf of defendant.  10:10 am  Statement by Joe Moran on behalf of defendant.  10:12 am  Statement by Juanita Coleman, mother of defendant.  
10:17 am  Statement by Atty May with regard to all the people present in court today to support the defendant.  
10:17 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Wiedenfeld.  Exhibit 1 marked and identified as  Deft's ledger located in his bedroom.  
10:28 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty May.  
10:43 am  Statement by Defendant.  10:48 am  Further argument by Atty May.  
10:52 am  Court gives deft opportunity to make a final statement.  Response by Deft.  
10:52 am  Court takes 10 minute recess to consider everything that has been presented in court.  
11:02 am  Court in session.  Same appearances.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
4 yrs IC followed by 5 yrs ES for total length of sentence of 9 yrs;  Eligible for both CIP AND SAP;  No sentence credit;  

CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees including $200 in buy money to Walworth County Drug Enforcement Unit.  
2)  Comply with any counseling recommended by Agent.  
3)  No alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
4)  Not to possess prescription medication without a valid prescription and only in accordance with the prescribed amounts.  5)  No weapons.  
6)  Maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of the two.  
7)  No contact with Stephanie Stewart, Kylee Rugen or Anthony Gerambio.    
8)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

Court admonishes defendant that he is prohibited from possessing a firearm and may not vote until his civil rights are restored.  11:23 am  Court in recess.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Order For Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation report.

Defendant Lucas P Coleman in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Andrew R. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Lucas P Coleman in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Lucas P Coleman in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR.  Defendant Lucas P Coleman in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advise that they do have have an agreement and are prepared to proceed to trial.  Attorney Schwantes indicates he does not have any lab test results.  Attorney Johnson advises that the lab results just came into their office on February 26th.  This case is being bumped from the trial calendar by another case being tried on Monday.  Court sets new FPT and JT dates.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lucas P Coleman in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Lucas P Coleman in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea. Motion deadline 11-05-15. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH WILEMAN SCHOOL, NO KNOWING CONTACT WITH THEIR STUDENTS OR C.I. 1063 IF KNOWN TO DEFENDANT.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Lucas P Coleman appeared.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes Filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Including an attached inventory list of seized items
